sentences.en: "I was very unsure of myself after the divorce," she says, unconsciously sweeping back the curls from her forehead.
sentences.cn: “离婚之后我变得非常不自信，”她边说边不自主地把额前的卷发往后捋了捋。

sentences.en: As if unsure of where she was, she hesitated and looked round.
sentences.cn: 她彷佛茫然不知身在何处, 犹犹豫豫向四周打量.

sentences.en: Beneath her self - confident surface , she's quite unsure of herself.
sentences.cn: 她看上去信心十足, 实际上很缺乏信心.

sentences.en: Chris seemed nervous and unsure of herself.
sentences.cn: 克丽丝显得紧张，没有自信。

sentences.en: Emily Dickinson too is unsure how to pitch her work.
sentences.cn: 艾米莉·狄更森也不知如何为自己的作品调音.

sentences.en: Fifty-two per cent were unsure about the idea.
sentences.cn: 五成二的人对这个想法存有疑虑。

sentences.en: His jaw was set, but his voice sounded thin and unsure.
sentences.cn: 他表情坚毅，但声音听起来却显得有气无力、犹豫不定。

sentences.en: I thought from the first that she was a little unsure about that marriage.
sentences.cn: 从一开始我就觉得她对那桩婚事心里没底。

sentences.en: If are unsure what to wear, you can always ask the host.
sentences.cn: 如果你拿不准该穿什么服装, 问主人就好了.

sentences.en: People, some obviously in shock, milled around like cattle, unsure of what to do.
sentences.cn: 人们像牛似地漫无目的地转悠, 有些人显然惊魂未定, 不知该做什么.

sentences.en: Scientists are becoming increasingly unsure of the validity of this technique.
sentences.cn: 科学家们越来越拿不准这一技术是否正当合法。

sentences.en: She told him that she was very unsure of herself.
sentences.cn: 她告诉他,她对自己感到非常惶惑不定.

sentences.en: She was still a foreigner, unsure of her ground.
sentences.cn: 她仍是一位异乡人, 对自己的地位缺乏信心.

sentences.en: The evening show was terrible, with hesitant unsure performances from all.
sentences.cn: 晚上的演出很糟，所有人都缩手缩脚，显得很不自信。

sentences.en: There were a lot of things I was unsure about.
They were already baffled and for the time being unsure of themselves.
sentences.cn: 他们已经受到挫折.暂时他们自己也拿不定主意.

words.tran_cn: 不确定的；不肯定的；没有自信的

trans.tran_cn: 不确定的，缺乏信心的，无把握的，不稳定的，不可靠的
trans.tran_en: not certain about something or about what you have to do
